header.title: Racism like Danny Baker’s tweet is usually explained away. I’m glad the BBC fired him
header.postText: A piece like this usually starts with how shocked the writer is about a racist incident but I think it’s time to be honest with readers and say, as a black woman, I am no longer shocked by the extent and dare I say it, the unimaginative nature of racism across the world.', 'The most recent racist nonsense stars Danny Baker who, until this morning, was a BBC Radio 5 Live DJ.', 'While some of us – especially as an expectant mother myself – were feeling elated for the royal couple on the birth of Archie (albeit ignoring a faint sense of worry for Meghan due to the harsh treatment she’s received), Baker thought it would be a perfect time to tweet a picture of a monkey in a suit holding the hands of two well-dressed people.', 'Danny captioned this picture with ‘royal baby leaves hospital’ and we are all aware of which baby this picture made reference to.', 'Danny Baker insists that his tweet isn’t racist because his mind isn’t ‘diseased’ and I think that statement actually annoyed me more than his horrendous tweet.', 'I am bored of hearing people defending their racist actions with statements like: ‘I’m not racist because I’m not a bad person’.', 'Perpetuating racism doesn’t require you to be a ‘bad’ person. It merely requires that your views of the world are informed by the myth you’ve been socialised into from birth – that you are superior to another group of people based on race.', 'I am not shocked by Danny Baker’s tweet but I am saddened by it for the same reason I was saddened by Alan Sugar’s tweet about the Senegalese world cup team.', 'Both of these men are old enough (but not too old) to be able to identify the error in their ways yet they refuse to. Even in their ‘apologies’ there’s a staunch refusal to acknowledge how deeply hurtful their ‘banter’ might be to those who are the subjects of it.', 'There are so many books and resources out there to explain racism in factual and humorous ways. Reni Eddo-Lodge wrote Why I’m No Longer Talking To White People About Race and I created a satirical animated character called Sally in HR.', 'For those who are perplexed as to why the tweet by Danny is so offensive, it is important to address the fact that Meghan’s mother is a black woman.', 'It is Archie’s proximity to blackness that inspired Danny’s tweet of a monkey, whether he chooses to acknowledge this or not.', 'For centuries black people have been likened to monkeys. This is why I say racism is unimaginative at times, the same tropes are used against black people time and time again.', 'Then again the dehumanising imagery must be reinforced consistently for it to have any power. Archie has been likened to a monkey because of the black ancestry he possesses. Michelle Obama was referred to as an ‘ape in heels’ while she was still first lady. For the royal baby and the former first lady to have been likened to primates just goes to show that racism doesn’t disappear depending on the class you find yourself in within society.', 'What kind of racism should my child expect as an everyday person? Probably something much worse and I hate to even think about it. I am aware though, that I must be prepared for it.', 'Danny Baker’s tweet supports archaic race biology whether he knows enough history to be aware of this or not. It is a stance that claims black people are biologically inferior to white people and was very popular in the 1600s. It also became the basis of many theories that other ‘intellectuals’ published, like Karl Vogt who believed black people were related to apes and thus not fully human.', 'These nonsensical ‘scientific findings’ only served to temporarily legitimise atrocities like the transatlantic slave trade, colonisation and segregation/apartheid.', 'I am glad Danny Baker has been relieved of his role as a DJ at the BBC because men like him say incredibly racist things frequently and it is explained away.', 'I think this happens because the average Brit isn’t taught about the extent of atrocities the empire committed based on racism and therefore see no harm in their myopic and antiquated views.', 'To the best of my knowledge pictures of monkeys weren’t posted online to welcome the births of Archie’s royal cousins, George, Charlotte and Louis, so there is really no excuse for this type of behaviour.', 'The BBC made the right decision on this occasion and hopefully it will inspire people to educate themselves on why such a post is incredibly offensive.', 'Better education regarding history is necessary for us all if we are to move past disgusting behaviour such as the one exhibited by Danny Baker.', 'A baby who hasn’t even had a chance to really experience the world is already stripped of his humanity because of his blackness. I want better for Archie, for my unborn child and for all our children.
header.socioLingVar: Ethnicity - General,Ethnicity - Black,Age - General,Age - Over 65s,Age - Youngsters

commentThread.commentText: I think its disgusting Danny Baker has been sacked, it was a joke, it was very funny. No one moans about Prince Charles big ears or Harry being a ginge when jokes and cartoons are made about them!

replies.commentText: Jaxx Downes this is the whitest comment ever.

I was under the impression we ""ALL'" supposed to have developed from apes and chimps . . There's no reference to colour then is there. . . To me it just seems over the top to sack him, what happened to people laughing it off and not taking offence etc. . . Out and out racism is deplorable, either verbally, mentally or physically . . .But there has to be give and take on all sides . . And I don't see that's ever happened. . . .Besides us white chalky honkys need a giggle same as everyone else does I'm sure.
Congratulations to Jaxx and Dean for being part of the problem 🙂

Dean Procter He reffered to someone who has part black/afro carribean heritage as a monkey, when historically the term has been used as a demeaning and negative term abou t black/brown people by racists.. They - the racists - u se monkey chants towa rds black players at football matches even now... and it was used in the 70's along with the N word and golly wog..to refere to people of colour..Not something to joke about!
Are you taking the piss? It's beyond racist!

My bad then . . . Maybe it's because I don't witness said racism . . . . But then I don't really see colours . . .I just see people . . If someone's a Twatt their a Twatt no matter what colour or ethenticity they. . . The world's full of twatts.
Dean Procter Your whole comment is ...... wow you possess such a negative mind.Sad.
Connor Mackenzie Grow up, woke boy.
Suzy Jackson what a stupid comeback.
Dean Procter "I don't see colours." Seriously, just google that racist phrase and then delete your comment.

commentThread.commentText: What Dean P and Jaxx D are missing is that tropes and stereotypes like this have been actively used to poison peoples' minds on how they regard black people. That includes how intelligent they are supposed to be, how they 'fit in' (with white society) and how they will be regarded at interviews for education, employment and promotion. The same cannot be said about images of Charles Big Ears since it affects his life chances not one iota.

I think it was more careless than racist. Anyone who follows him would have realised this, his response at the time echoes that. Time for people to get some collumn inches on things we already know. Racism is horrible. But if it is horrible, why is it you can only be a racist if your white? Maybe we should tackle that aswell?

replies.commentText: Russell Jacques its blatantly racist

Maggie Orourke If he didnt intend on it being racist, then how is that? He didnt do it to cause offence to people of african descent. He did it to make reference of the circus that is the Royal Family. If it wa s racist, do you not think he would have defended his reasons for using a Monkey? Nope, he said he later realised there was a connection he hadnt realised and deleted the pic. To me, thats a simple mistake.
Of course he intended it to be racist and him saying he didn't is a blatant lie. I actually can't believe people are defending this absolutely disgusting.
Your a vile excuse for a human.

Maggie Orourke and a mind reader are we? You are making an assumption that fits your argument, provide proof of his racism, or are you just making an assumption about a middle aged white man, which is both racist an d ageist.

Paul Eiken youre right...honestly paul.. its like pot calling kettle black. So many people standing up for racism.. im fine with that. But when its not actuall y racist and the people lynching him act in a su do racist manner it really makes you wonder if they are actually bothered its ab out racism... or just an opportunity to have a whinge on the internet. Im trying to be sensible here and allow people to make a judgement that it wasnt intention ally racist and when he realised it was he withdrew.... doesnt sound l ike a racist to me that. Did he defend the link? Did he say som ething racist like " i like the blacks?"... no... he simply said... im sorry didnt realise there was a link. Anyone who listens to his shows know he refers to chimps all the time... regardless the situation.

This is racist, point blank. There's no getting around it. Joke or not. What a group of people does or doesn't find racist can not be defined by the one bein g racist. The "joke" was hurtful, obviously not to you, him and all the other people defending him, but it remains so. Saying that he was "making a reference of the circus that is the royal family" is bull. Couldn't he have chosen a different picture for that. One with an entire circus perhaps? It was ignorance on his end, but it was offensive, hurtful a nd racist.

Katura Morganfield having followed him for years... he uses chimps and apes in reference to lots of things. Its comical... its funny... theyre daft looking dressed up in human clothes... If he had chosen not to use that picture would that have also been racist? Point being he was always going to be judged whether he was a racist or not... he cant win because the people maki g the judgement are poor at doing so... preferring to be enraged than to go say " u know what...he apologised maybe it was a fuckup" but people cant do that... can they. When can we have clear rules on what i s racist and whats not..?... white chicks... white man.. worse things are everywhere... but white men only ever get labelled. If the rules are set like that no wonder theres outright confusion... is that danny's fault? Is he to blame? Is he a bad guy?

Russell Jacques you following him and his personal thoughts are two totally different things. It's comical to you, but not to me. That's the point. As I've said before, you can not choose what is or isn't offensive to someone else. Just as one guy in the comments found it offensive that another commenter assumed they knew his ethnicity. It may not be offensive to them, but it is to him no matter how pointless it is. He's too old to make a 'mistake' that blatantly offensive. It's good that he apologized, but to find that funny shows something off inside him. I haven't labeled anyone. I did label the situation a s racist though. He may not be an inherently bad guy, but his environment has made him insensitive and develop a sick sense of humor

Katura Morganfield but picking a picture of a chimp was never about his race.... it was about the circus which is the royal family... see this innocent being being paraded infront of the media no sense of itself yet.... flash go the cameras... scribble go the pens... yet this little character is oblivious... just like the chimp.

Russell Jacques it's just too sensitive a subject to joke around about. The monkey thing was a bad choice for that situation. He should have put more thought into it. It's offensive in the end. Yes, the media took it and ran. Yes, they are blowing it up, but it is wrong. Wrong picture, wrong family, wrong person to post it. A joke should be obvious to everyone. If it's not then it wasn't well thought out or funny. The monkey/Black people thing flows too deep. A circus isn't, so he should have used clowns or something. Anything other than a monkey

Russell Jacques ''He did it to make reference to what a circus the royal family are''. How do you know..where did it say that in his post..? I only see '' Royal baby leaves hospital''..no mention of a circus..
Michael Masters keep getting angry... keep turning my points into racist incensed madness. Im just saying this was a mistake by a human being. With no racist intent in it. He made a mistake...

commentThread.commentText: Quote 1 "It is Archie’s proximity to blackness that inspired Danny’s tweet of a monkey, whether he chooses to acknowledge this or not."You don't know that and it's libel to says so. I hope he takes action against you.Quote 2 "I am glad Danny Baker has been relieved of his role as a DJ at the BBC because men like him say incredibly racist things frequently and it is explained away."Maybe you could post a few more examples of Danny Baker saying "incredibl y racist things frequently" and then I'd be happy to agree with you're opinion of him. (PS I will say that I do agree with other points made in this article about a constant level of racism in the world. We still have a long way to go, but Danny Baker is wrong target)

i agree Derek. Racism is the easiest stereotype bandwagon to jump onto. This wasnt meant to be a racist joke, yet people have developed it into something akin to a beheading. He didnt realise, he deleted, he apologised. No one can make mistakes anymore - mistake which hurt no one too....

It's funny all the people saying it isn't racist are infact white!!🙄 You have no idea what it feels like to be discriminated against because of colour and nor do I difference is I know racism when I see it and it makes me sick to my stomach an i call people out o n racist behaviour I don't make excuses for it because there are none!!!
Derel you're a racist, go on sue me
Maggie Orourke You can't prove a negative. Hence it's never "prove you didn't do it".

Maggie Orourke There you go again talking about my ethnicity. Is it possible you can try and have this conversation without insulting other people.
Chris Little Thank you for your valuable contribution to the debate about Danny Baker's Tweet and the way he's been treated by the BBC and the media.
Maggie Orourke now with more of the abuse!
Derek Evans You're shocked at me stating..''No person of colour I know'' how is it a sweeping statemant..please expalin? And ''a remark any famous person should stay away from...?
El Abdulla I (genuinely) apologise, I mis-read your remark and did not realise you meant only people you know. Sorry, that also makes your remark fair enough.

I said that in reply to your comment to the C Bennet who suggested/assumed your ethnicity was white.. You said ''she doesn't know your back ground'' etc..or ethnicity..half suggeting she was mistaken..why be vague? Th e woman made an assumption base on the fact, its highley unlikly a person of colour is going to defend a ''racis t'' monkey reference..and more likley to be defended and made light of by a racist white person...
Derek Evans you can't teach stupid so I give up. You carry on being racist!!🙄

El Abdulla I'm not very good at this type of thing. But I'm hoping this link will work: [LINK] It's quite a lot of reading and I can't work out how to direct this thread to specific replies. But there are plenty of people saying they are a black and do not think it was deliberate and supporting Danny Baker. I'm glad that there is a debate about what happened.

Maggie Orourke I see several people have tried but no-one can teach you not to be abusive. PS You've insulted my whole ethnicity, my opinion and my intelligence, feel free to mention my sexuality and religion you'll have (nearly) a full set then.

commentThread.commentText: I don't see that any stripping of humanity has occurred to the baby. Human beings possess humanity by sheer fact of existence. I also don't agree about the idea of 'causing hurt'. Only physical intervention does that. You can't reach into someone's mind and control / dictate their emotions; humans aren't robots. One's response depends on context and that is a personal matter. I.e., I can understand people taking offence, but offence isn't 'caused' as if it were a law of the universe.I do think though that Danny Baker knew what he was tweeting, and I do think he was unbelievably stupid for doing so....

replies.commentText: Do you really think its wise to go around displaying your ignorance so blatantly and arrogantly? Youre pathetic.

Sinse Milla well firstly I love you too - and we don't even know each other! Secondly, just look at Martin Kelly's link below [LINK] take your foot out of your mouth. Are you going to call that anti-semitism out? Course not. Or at least not once you've found it in the dictionary...Thirdly, (keep the dictionary to hand - you'll need it), the idea that it is ignorant or pathetic to point out the simple fact that no non-physical phenomenon is capable of altering one's neural causality, especially when the agent in question is an opinion, utterance, image or the printed word, is itself ignoract and pathetic.That said I still maintain there is no way Danny Baker didn't know that was racist. No way at all.

commentThread.commentText: "Karl Vogt who believed black people were related to apes and thus not fully human."Chimps and black people ar e black, have wide noses and thick lips because human evolved from apes in hot tropical Africa.People evolved whiter skin, narrow a nd thin noses as they moved to colder climates.That is blacks achieved the leap f rom ape to human .And blacks have been humans longer than whites.Being compared to a chimp is only an insult is you don't understand human evolution. and are primed to take offence..Language was a key to humanity.I am not surprise d my African wife usually wins our arguments ...

replies.commentText: Roger Clague it's meant as an insult, what is your point? That we should just let this disgusting behaviour go by without saying anything? We all descended from apes but I didn't see anyone tweet this when any other royal baby was born?? Take your post and shove it .
No, opposable thumbs were you racist thundercunt

commentThread.commentText: The article seems to stand or fall on this statement: "It is Archie’s proximity to blackness that inspired Danny’s tweet of a monkey, whether he chooses to acknowledge this or not."If that's not true, everything else in article is irrelevant (is, in fact, possibly libellous). So I think it needs a bit more explanation - it doesn't seem so self-evident to me that that is the case.
Beautifully written. X
Kelechi Okafor is a raging hypocrite. Thinks nothing of being anti-semitic when the mood takes her and makes no apology for it. [LINK]

replies.commentText: omg that's horrific

commentThread.commentText: How disgusting to compare anyone's child to a chimp or monkey...how degrading rude nasty racist and unacceptable in this day an d age. No matter who the child happens to be related to this reference to monkeys is a absolute disgrace and trying to deny racial connections makes the whole incident cheap nastier and mean...what a low life....H

Pathetic! Kelechi your piece is actually quite offensive and naive. The “ slave “ trade was in fruition when “ whites” arrived in Africa. Blacks, sold black slaves, to other blacks, who then seen the opportunity to make more money from the overseas markets and hence the transportation of slaves to the west. As for the “ Monkey “ theory, we are ALL derived from primates and it’s just a pigment that derives our eventua l ethnicity.

replies.commentText: Marc Dougherty the expert on slavery!! This is about a white man posting a picture of a chimp and comparing it to the new royal baby who happens to be of black decent. It was racist and no amount of white people saying otherwise makes that fact any different. I'm actually ashamed to read these comments. Totally disgusted infact. Hes a 60 yea r old man he knew exactly what he was doing and has lost his job so hell mend him!!

commentThread.commentText: Freedom of expression/ speech??? Nothing to do with racism, everything to do with freedom.. . brexit of expression!!!! Bravo
Fuk the media

LOL @ The mental gymnastics low-key racist white ppl are doing in the comments section is hilarious. “Oh Danny’s no t racist, he was just being funny, anyone that follows his work knows would know that” 🙄😂To make a careless “joke” about a newborn baby is disgusting.Whatever happened to being decent and thoughtful human beings?? The lot of you are cancers and cowards.
It was a bad call. But do believe it was with out malice. Danny Baker is not a bad guy and not a racist. It all depends how you look in to it.
WOW. Racist Low Life beating up on a newborn baby.

I see it's mostly white people who are up in arms about him being fired, and explaining away any "ill will" because he's a nice bloke.Maybe us whities could try two things here, shutting up and listening. I know, it's radical but I think we're more than ready.

When I first saw it, I thought it mildly funny and maybe a slight dig at the royals. I never even thought of this as at all racist. It didn't enter my head until mentioned by others. This is British sense of humour which some may not understand. I think it a shame it's been blown up in such a fashion.

replies.commentText: Don't you dare pull us all into your pit - i'm British - it's a shite joke.
